text: Hadleigh is a town near the A1071 road, in the Babergh district, in the county of Suffolk, England. The name Hadleigh comes from Haethlega (a heath-covered place). Hadleigh is the headquarters of Babergh District Council, but the largest town in the district is Sudbury It is also part of the south Suffolk constituency. with a population of about 8,000. == References == Category:Towns in Suffolk Category:Civil parishes in Suffolk Category:Settlements in Babergh
title: Hadleigh, Suffolk
